# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.2e4a08cd:
#Codes by Gaurav Dutta https://www.kaggle.com/gauravduttakiit/working-with-pdf-files

f = open('../input/cusersmarildownloadsselfishpdf/selfish.pdf','rb')

# List of every page's text.
# The index will correspond to the page number.
pdf_text = [0]  # zero is a placehoder to make page 1 = index 1

pdf_reader = PyPDF2.PdfFileReader(f)

for p in range(pdf_reader.numPages):
    
    page = pdf_reader.getPage(p)
    
    pdf_text.append(page.extractText())

f.close()

from gtts import gTTS
tts = gTTS(pdf_text[1])
tts.save('output.mp3')

#Who are The Altruists, The Suckers, the Cheaters and the Grudgers?

Who is going to take the "metaphorical ticks" of my head. In other words: fixing the stupid things I make and transform them in real code?

Any way, reciprocal altruism can evolve in species that are capable of recognizing and remembering each other as
individuals.

#That happens to Hawks, Doves, why not with Kagglers since all of us are birds too? Think about that Kagglers.

#Richard Dawkins is so amazing because he described our community in 1976. Isn't that impressive Kagglers?
